fields.description:
Request that a new property be created which manages Equallogic SAN to toggle thin provisioning on/off.

This will enable a cloud to save significant space in their EQL SAN.
fields.summary: create a property to be able to toggle thin provisioning on/off (Equallogic)

comments.body:
Introduced two cluster level configurable properties that allow toggling thin provisioning and configuring the minimum reserve. 

Description of the properties
{noformat}
# euctl -s one.storage.eqlthinprovision
one.storage.eqlthinprovision = Thin provision space on Equallogic SAN. Value must be true to enable and false to disable thin provisioning

# euctl -s one.storage.eqlthinminreserve
one.storage.eqlthinminreserve = Minimum volume reserve for a thin-provisioned volume expressed as a % of the volume size. This is the amount of immediately writable, guaranteed space reserved for the volume
{noformat}

Default values for the properties
{noformat}
# euctl -d one.storage.eqlthinprovision
one.storage.eqlthinprovision = false

# euctl -d one.storage.eqlthinminreserve
one.storage.eqlthinminreserve = 10
{noformat}

The properties can be configured using euctl 
{noformat}
# euctl one.storage.eqlthinprovision=true
one.storage.eqlthinprovision = true

# euctl one.storage.eqlthinminreserve=30
one.storage.eqlthinminreserve = 30
{noformat}

These properties take effect only during fresh or from scratch EBS volume creation. EBS Volumes created from previously existing snapshots will inherit the provisioning settings of the parent. The same applies for EBS snapshots as well.

Enabling thin provisioning works as expected. {code} # euctl one.storage.eqlthinprovision=true --region admin@localhost one.storage.eqlthinprovision = true # euca-create-volume -s 5 -z one VOLUME vol-a29aad19 5 one creating 2016-07-12T22:56:47.839Z {code} Volume in Equallogic after thin provisioning is enabled: {code} eucagrp> show volume vol-a29aad19 _____________________________ Volume Information ______________________________ Name: vol-a29aad19 Size: 5GB VolReserve: 525MB VolReserveInUse: 0MB ReplReserveInUse: 0MB iSCSI Alias: vol-a29aad19 iSCSI Name: ActualMembers: 1 iqn.2001-05.com.equallogic:0-8a0906- Snap-Warn: 10% f4f41cf08-6a6c00ab17857857-vol-a29aa Snap-Depletion: delete-oldest d19 Description: Snap-Reserve: 100% Snap-Reserve-Avail: 100% (525MB) Permission: read-write DesiredStatus: online Status: online Connections: 0 Snapshots: 0 Bind: Type: not-replicated ReplicationReserveSpace: 0MB Replicas: 0 ReplicationPartner: Pool: default Transmitted-Data: 0MB Received-Data: 0MB Pref-Raid-Policy: none Pref-Raid-Policy-Status: none Thin-Provision: enabled Thin-Min-Reserve: 10% (525MB) Thin-Growth-Warn: 60% (3GB) Thin-Growth-Max: 100% (5GB) ReplicationTxData: 0MB MultiHostAccess: enabled iSNS-Discovery: disabled Replica-Volume-Reserve: 0MB Thin-Clone: N Template: N NAS Container: N Administrator: SyncReplStatus: SyncReplTxData: 0MB Thin-Warn-Mode: offline Snap-space Borrowing: enabled Space Borrowed: 0MB Folder: SectorSize: 512 _______________________________________________________________________________ {code} However, modifying {{one.storage.eqlthinminreserve}} fails with {{euctl}}, {code} # euctl one.storage.eqlthinminreserve=20 --region admin@localhost euctl: error (ModifyPropertyValueType): java.lang.Integer cannot be cast to java.lang.String [root@g-08-10 ~]# [root@g-08-10 ~]# [root@g-08-10 ~]# euctl one.storage.eqlthinminreserve=5 --region admin@localhost euctl: error (ModifyPropertyValueType): java.lang.Integer cannot be cast to java.lang.String [root@g-08-10 ~]# euctl one.storage.eqlthinminreserve=20 --region admin@localhost --debug 2016-07-12 16:01:19,564 DEBUG Euctl parsed arguments: {'reset': False, 'show_defaults': False, 'security_token': None, 'dump': False, 'all_types': False, 'format': 'json', 'suppress_name': False, 'region': 'admin@localhost', 'edit': False, 'prop_pairs': [('one.storage.eqlthinminreserve', '20')], 'url': None, 'show_descriptions': False, 'key_id': None, 'suppress_all': False, 'secret_key': None} 2016-07-12 16:01:19,565 INFO Config set region to [~shaon], thanks for verifying the new feature and lets open another ticket for the issue you found

Verified.

Opened EUCA-12556 for the {{eqlthinminreserve}} modify issue.

[~shaon], ignore my previous comment, I think this ticket should be rejected from QA based on your test. Theres no point in toggling thin provisioning ({{storage.eqlthinprovision}}) without the ability to modify the default amount of space reserved ({{storage.eqlthinminreserve}}). I'm not entirely sure how this passed my verification, looking into it right now.

[~swathi], I think it's okay to mark this ticket as release pending, since this is a improvement ticket and the feature is actually implemented. EUCA-12556 is a bug, feel free to change the status as Confirmed and work on that ticket for a new commit.
Thanks for taking quick action on this.
Reverting from Release Pending and QA states since the ticket is not implemented in its entirety. EUCA-12556 restricts the functionality of this improvement.
